Key Arguments: Free speech is vital for democracy and should allow opinions on any subject.
Individuals should be responsible for their statements and face legal consequences if they cause harm.
A small group should not decide what is true or false, as truths can change over time.
Censorship prevents debate and only allows one side of a story.
Censoring free speech is unconstitutional and akin to blackmailing social media companies.
Main Themes: Responsibility and legal consequences for misinformation
Concerns about censorship and government overreach
Notable Quotes: It is absolutely vital for any Democracy to allow free speech.
How can you have a group of five or six people decide what is true and what is not?
It is our constitutional right to practise free speech, it would be illegal to censor that by trying to blackmail social Media companies with fines.
